intro: Solanum nigrum var. legitimum, commonly known as black nightshade, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into dark purple to black berries, which are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
